intro: Geissorhiza bicolor var. macowanii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored flowers that come in shades of yellow and red. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense clumps. The flowers are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and are adapted to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
